trustfund:
TF033969-AFRICA REGION - ROCK, PHOSPHATE,TF050516-PHRD-BURKINA FASO: POVERTY
            REDUCTION SUPPORT CREDIT III (PRSC)

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings suggest a satisfactory
            project outcome, likely sustainability, substantial
            institutional development impacts, and satisfactory
            performances by the Bank and Borrower. Lessons highlight
            that the Poverty Reduction Support Credit (PRSC) series
            greatly reinforced the importance of the budget, and the
            country's own capacity for the success of government
            policies, steadily strengthening the focus on the budget as
            the main instrument for PRSP implementation. PRSCs also
            successfully supported a number of cross-cutting reforms.
            These reforms included the application of de-concentration
            policies in budget and personnel management, which are part
            of the policies to improve social service delivery. In the
            cotton sector, the opening of two zones for private
            investors, involved the establishment of the new regulatory
            framework, and the definition of roles of the new and old
            stakeholders. However, despite achievements, a number of
            challenges remain for the PRSCs. Burkina Faso faces
            difficulties in attracting private investment as a result of
            low skill levels, and high costs of production factors. The
            growth agenda of the PRSP should therefore be an additional
            important area for support under future PRSCs, as well as
            for the Country Assistance Strategy. Other lessons outline
            improving the PRSC-related sectoral dialogue; aligning
            budget support with the budget cycle; reinforcing
            capacities; improving the link between policy actions and
            the monitoring and evaluation framework; and, improving
            inter-ministerial coordination.
